member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.CalendarEdit
member.summary:
Represents a control that enables the user to select a date using a visual calendar display that depends on the culture settings.
The control supports Windows themes ( Default, Silver, Metallic, Zune, Royale and Aero) and skins (Office2003, Office2007Blue, Office2007Black, Office2007Silver and Blend ). Also the user can define own skin by setting necessary properties of the class.
CalendarEdit partial class which holds dependency properties.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.CalendarEdit.OnMouseLeftButtonDown(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled routed event is raised on this element. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
member.param: The that contains the event data. The event data reports that the left mouse button was pressed.
member.remarks: The MouseLeftButtonDown event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. Mouse.MouseDown is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each ContentElement along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event MouseLeftButtonDown. Although you can mark the MouseLeftButtonDown event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify handledEventsToo) from being invoked. The default implementation for general mouse event handling in ContentElement listens for Mouse.MouseDown and converts it to an appropriate local event. If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for Mouse.MouseDown. You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of ContentElement by overriding OnMouseLeftButtonDown. Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke OnMouseLeftButtonDown. For example, you can derive from Button and override OnMouseLeftButtonDown in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the Click event.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.DwmIsCompositionEnabled(System.Boolean@)

member.param: The pointer that receives the value indicating whether DWM composition is enabled. TRUE if DWM composition is enabled; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.GetMonitorInfo(System.IntPtr,Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MONITORINFO)
member.summary: The MonitorFromWindow function retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: Handle to the display monitor of interest.

Pointer to a MONITORINFO or MONITORINFOEX structure that receives information about the specified display monitor.
You must set the cbSize member of the structure to sizeof(MONITORINFO) or sizeof(MONITORINFOEX) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.
The MONITORINFOEX structure is a superset of the MONITORINFO structure. It has one additional member\: a string that contains a name for the display monitor. Most applications have no use for a display monitor name, and so can save some bytes by using a MONITORINFO structure.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.GetSystemMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The GetSystemMenu function allows the application to access the window menu (also known as the system menu or the control menu) for copying and modifying.
member.param: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu.

Specifies the action to be taken. If this parameter is FALSE, GetSystemMenu returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified. If this parameter is TRUE, GetSystemMenu resets the window menu back to the default state. The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.
member.returns: If the bRevert parameter is FALSE, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu. If the bRevert parameter is TRUE, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MonitorFromWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MonitorFromWindow function retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: Handle to the window of interest.
Determines the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display monitor. This parameter can be one of the following values.
member.returns: If the window intersects one or more display monitor rectangles, the return value is an HMONITOR handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the window. If the window does not intersect a display monitor, the return value depends on the value of dwFlags.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SendMessage function sends the specified message to a window or windows. It calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top\-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop\-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
member.returns: The return value specifies the result of the message processing; it depends on the message sent.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.TrackPopupMenu(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The TrackPopupMenu function displays a shortcut menu at the specified location and tracks the selection of items on the menu. The shortcut menu can appear anywhere on the screen.
member.param: Handle to the shortcut menu to be displayed. The handle can be obtained by calling CreatePopupMenu to create a new shortcut menu, or by calling GetSubMenu to retrieve a handle to a submenu associated with an existing menu item.
Use zero of more of these flags to specify function options.More information can be found on the following link\: http\://msdn2.microsoft.com/en\-us/library/ms648002.aspx
Specifies the horizontal location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.
Specifies the vertical location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

Handle to the window that owns the shortcut menu. This window receives all messages from the menu. The window does not receive a WM_COMMAND message from the menu until the function returns. If you specify TPM_NONOTIFY in the uFlags parameter, the function does not send messages to the window identified by hWnd. However, you must still pass a window handle in hWnd. It can be any window handle from your application.
member.returns: If you specify TPM_RETURNCMD in the uFlags parameter, the return value is the menu-item identifier of the item that the user selected. If the user cancels the menu without making a selection, or if an error occurs, then the return value is zero. If you do not specify TPM_RETURNCMD in the uFlags parameter, the return value is nonzero if the function succeeds and zero if it fails. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MONITORINFO
member.summary: The MONITORINFO structure contains information about a display monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MONITORINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes. Set the cbSize member to sizeof(MONITORINFO) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.

members.member:
A RECT structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates.
Note If the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

A RECT structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates.
Note If the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MONITORINFO.dwFlags
member.summary: A set of flags that represent attributes of the display monitor.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO
member.summary: The MINMAXINFO structure contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptReserved
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximized width (POINT.x) and the maximized height (POINT.y) of the window. For top-level windows, this value is based on the width of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position of the left side of the maximized window (POINT.x) and the position of the top of the maximized window (POINT.y). For top-level windows, this value is based on the position of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMinTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum tracking width (POINT.x) and the minimum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMINTRACK and SM_CYMINTRACK.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.ChromelessWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum tracking width (POINT.x) and the maximum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value is based on the size of the virtual screen and can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMAXTRACK and SM_CYMAXTRACK.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock
member.summary: Represents a Clock control.
member.remarks:
Clock class models a ticking clock. This class is used to tick current or user-defined time.
A Clock enables user dragging its hands, doing mouse wheel operations and choosing am/pm time. Also Clock control contains a text block to display time.
To create a Clock using C# you can use the Clock method.
A Clock supports Windows themes (Default, Silver, Metallic, Zune, Royale and Aero) and skins (Office2003, Office2007Blue, Office2007Black, Office2007Silver and Blend). Also you can define your own user skin by setting properties of the Clock class.
member.summary: Clock class that provides us the visual style properties of clock control

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock.DateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets date and time of the . This is a dependency property.
member.value: Type: Provides DateTime value for the . The default value of the DateTime property is DateTime.Now.
member.remarks: DateTime dependency property is used for getting or setting date or time of the . Every tick of the clock updates DateTime property. Also DateTime property is updated when you drag hands of the clock of do mouse wheel operations with clock hands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock.ClockCornerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets CornerRadius value of the . This is a dependency property.
member.value: Type: Provides ClockCornerRadius value for the . The default value of the ClockCornerRadius property is 90.
member.remarks: ClockCornerRadius dependency property defines corner radius of the . If you set low ClockCornerRadius, the clock will be square. If you set high ClockCornerRadius, the clock will be round.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock.BorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets border thickness value of the . This is a dependency property.
member.value: Type: Provides BorderThickness value for the . The default value of the BorderThickness property is 2.
member.remarks: BorderThickness dependency property defines border thickness of the .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock.DialBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets dial border thickness value of the . This is a dependency property.
member.value: Type: Provides DialBorderThickness value for the . The default value of the InnerBorderThickness property is 25.
member.remarks: DialBorderThickness dependency property defines dial border thickness of the .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock.AMPMSelectorPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets AMPMSelectorPosition of the . This is a dependency property.
member.value: Type: Provides AMPMSelectorPosition value for the . The default value of the AMPMSelectorPosition property is Bottom.
member.remarks: You can set one of four values for AMPMSelectorPosition dependency property (Top, Left, Right, Bottom). To see the result of setting AMPMSelectorPosition dependency property you should set dependency property value to True.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock.IsInsideAmPmVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is inside am pm visible.
member.value: Type: Provides IsInsideAmPmVisible value for the . The default value of the IsInsideAmPmVisible property is False.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.Clock.IsDigitalAmPmVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is digital am pm visible.
member.value: Type: Provides IsDigitalAmPmVisible value for the . The default value of the IsDigitalAmPmVisible property is True.
member.remarks: If you set IsDigitalAmPmVisible to False, you`ll not be able to change am/pm value of the from the digital clock.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.DomainUpDown
member.summary: DomainUpDown class that provides the UpDown control
member.remarks:
Represents an up-down control that displays string values.
A DomainUpDown control displays a single string value that is selected from the collection of items by pressing the up or down buttons on keyboard or scrolling the mouse wheel. The user can also enter text in the control.
To create a collection of items to display in the DomainUpDown control, user can add or remove the items individually by using the and methods. This can be called in an event handler, such as the event of a button.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a window.
member.param: Either the handle of the window to position this window behind, or a flag stating where in the Z-order to put the window: * -2 = Put the window below all topmost windows and above all non-topmost windows. * -1 = Make the window topmost (above all other windows) permanently. * 0 = Put the window at the top of the Z-order. * 1 = Put the window at the bottom of the Z-order.
The x coordinate of where to put the upper-left corner of the window.
The y coordinate of where to put the upper-left corner of the window.
The x coordinate of where to put the lower-right corner of the window.
The y coordinate of where to put the lower-right corner of the window.

Zero or more of the following flags stating how to move the window: * 32 = Fully redraw the window in its new position. * 128 = Hide the window from the screen. * 16 = Do not make the window active after moving it unless it was already the active window. * 256 = Do not redraw anything drawn on the window after it is moved. * 2 = Do not move the window. * 1 = Do not resize the window. * 8 = Do not remove the image of the window in its former position, effectively leaving a ghost image on the screen. * 4 = Do not change the window's position in the Z-order. * 64 = Show the window if it is hidden.
member.returns: Returns 1 if successful, or 0 if an error occurred.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.GetWindowRect(System.IntPtr,Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.RECT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.DwmIsCompositionEnabled(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Obtains a value that indicates whether Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition is enabled. Applications can listen for composition state changes by handling the WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED notification.
member.param: The pointer that receives the value indicating whether DWM composition is enabled. TRUE if DWM composition is enabled; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.GetMonitorInfo(System.IntPtr,Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MONITORINFO)
member.summary: The MonitorFromWindow function retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: Handle to the display monitor of interest.

Pointer to a MONITORINFO or MONITORINFOEX structure that receives information about the specified display monitor.
You must set the cbSize member of the structure to sizeof(MONITORINFO) or sizeof(MONITORINFOEX) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.
The MONITORINFOEX structure is a superset of the MONITORINFO structure. It has one additional member\: a string that contains a name for the display monitor. Most applications have no use for a display monitor name, and so can save some bytes by using a MONITORINFO structure.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.GetSystemMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The GetSystemMenu function allows the application to access the window menu (also known as the system menu or the control menu) for copying and modifying.
member.param: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu.

Specifies the action to be taken. If this parameter is FALSE, GetSystemMenu returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified. If this parameter is TRUE, GetSystemMenu resets the window menu back to the default state. The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.
member.returns: If the bRevert parameter is FALSE, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu. If the bRevert parameter is TRUE, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MonitorFromWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MonitorFromWindow function retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: Handle to the window of interest.
Determines the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display monitor. This parameter can be one of the following values.
member.returns: If the window intersects one or more display monitor rectangles, the return value is an HMONITOR handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the window. If the window does not intersect a display monitor, the return value depends on the value of dwFlags.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SendMessage function sends the specified message to a window or windows. It calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top\-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop\-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
member.returns: The return value specifies the result of the message processing; it depends on the message sent.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.TrackPopupMenu(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The TrackPopupMenu function displays a shortcut menu at the specified location and tracks the selection of items on the menu. The shortcut menu can appear anywhere on the screen.
member.param: Handle to the shortcut menu to be displayed. The handle can be obtained by calling CreatePopupMenu to create a new shortcut menu, or by calling GetSubMenu to retrieve a handle to a submenu associated with an existing menu item.
Use zero of more of these flags to specify function options.More information can be found on the following link\: http\://msdn2.microsoft.com/en\-us/library/ms648002.aspx
Specifies the horizontal location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.
Specifies the vertical location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

Handle to the window that owns the shortcut menu. This window receives all messages from the menu. The window does not receive a WM_COMMAND message from the menu until the function returns. If you specify TPM_NONOTIFY in the uFlags parameter, the function does not send messages to the window identified by hWnd. However, you must still pass a window handle in hWnd. It can be any window handle from your application.
member.returns:
If you specify TPM_RETURNCMD in the uFlags parameter, the return value is the menu-item identifier of the item that the user selected. If the user cancels the menu without making a selection, or if an error occurs, then the return value is zero.
If you do not specify TPM_RETURNCMD in the uFlags parameter, the return value is nonzero if the function succeeds and zero if it fails. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MONITORINFO
member.summary: The MONITORINFO structure contains information about a display monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MONITORINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes. Set the cbSize member to sizeof(MONITORINFO) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.

members.member:
A RECT structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates.
Note If the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

A RECT structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates.
Note If the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MONITORINFO.dwFlags
member.summary: A set of flags that represent attributes of the display monitor.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO
member.summary: The MINMAXINFO structure contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptReserved
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximized width (POINT.x) and the maximized height (POINT.y) of the window. For top-level windows, this value is based on the width of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position of the left side of the maximized window (POINT.x) and the position of the top of the maximized window (POINT.y). For top-level windows, this value is based on the position of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMinTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum tracking width (POINT.x) and the minimum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMINTRACK and SM_CYMINTRACK.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.VistaWindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum tracking width (POINT.x) and the maximum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value is based on the size of the virtual screen and can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMAXTRACK and SM_CYMAXTRACK.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.DrawingHelper.OnRender(System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, participates in rendering operations that are directed by the layout system. The rendering instructions for this element are not used directly when this method is invoked, and are instead preserved for later asynchronous use by layout and drawing.
member.param: The drawing instructions for a specific element. This context is provided to the layout system.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.DrawingHelper.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, measures the size in layout required for child elements and determines a size for the -derived class.
member.param: The available size that this element can give to child elements. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the element will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this element determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child element sizes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.DrawingHelper.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, positions child elements and determines a size for a derived class.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS
member.summary: Represents window layout information.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS.hwnd
member.summary: Handle of window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS.hwndInsertAfter
member.summary: Either the handle of the window to position this window behind, or a flag stating where in the Z-order to put the window: * -2 = Put the window below all topmost windows and above all non-topmost windows. * -1 = Make the window topmost (above all other windows) permanently. * 0 = Put the window at the top of the Z-order. * 1 = Put the window at the bottom of the Z-order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS.x
member.summary: The x coordinate of where to put the upper-left corner of the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS.y
member.summary: The y coordinate of where to put the upper-left corner of the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS.cx
member.summary: The x coordinate of where to put the lower-right corner of the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS.cy
member.summary: The y coordinate of where to put the lower-right corner of the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WINDOWPOS.flags
member.summary: Zero or more of the following flags stating how to move the window: * 32 = Fully redraw the window in its new position. * 128 = Hide the window from the screen. * 16 = Do not make the window active after moving it unless it was already the active window. * 256 = Do not redraw anything drawn on the window after it is moved. * 2 = Do not move the window. * 1 = Do not resize the window. * 8 = Do not remove the image of the window in its former position, effectively leaving a ghost image on the screen. * 4 = Do not change the window's position in the Z-order. * 64 = Show the window if it is hidden.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants
member.summary: Stores flags for class functions.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter of ChromelessWindowInterop.SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hide the window from the screen.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the flag.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the message.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.HWND_NOTOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.HWND_TOP
member.summary: Places the window at the top of the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.HWND_TOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows. The window maintains its topmost position even when it is deactivated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.WM_NCHITTEST
member.summary: The WM_NCHITTEST message is sent to a window when the cursor moves, or when a mouse button is pressed or released. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.WM_MOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOVE message is sent after a window has been moved.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.HTTRANSPARENT
member.summary: In a window currently covered by another window in the same thread (the message will be sent to underlying windows in the same thread until one of them returns a code that is not HTTRANSPARENT).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.WM_SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.SC_KEYMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a keystroke. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.NIM_ADD
member.summary: Adds an icon to the status area. The hWnd and uID members of the NOTIFYICONDATA structure pointed to by lpdata will be used to identify the icon in later calls to Shell_NotifyIcon.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.NIM_MODIFY
member.summary: Modifies an icon in the status area. Use the hWnd and uID members of the NOTIFYICONDATA structure pointed to by lpdata to identify the icon to be modified.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeConstants.NIM_DELETE
member.summary: Deletes an icon from the status area. Use the hWnd and uID members of the NOTIFYICONDATA structure pointed to by lpdata to identify the icon to be deleted.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeMethods.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a window.
member.param: Either the handle of the window to position this window behind, or a flag stating where in the Z-order to put the window.
The x coordinate of where to put the upper-left corner of the window.
The y coordinate of where to put the upper-left corner of the window.
The x coordinate of where to put the lower-right corner of the window.
The y coordinate of where to put the lower-right corner of the window.
Specifies the window sizing and positioning flags.
member.returns: Returns 1 if successful, or 0 if an error occurred.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeMethods.ClipCursor(Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.RECT@)
member.summary: Confines the cursor to a rectangular area on the screen.

member.returns: Returns true if successful, or false if an error occurred.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeMethods.ClipCursor(System.Object)
member.summary: The ClipCursor function confines the cursor to a rectangular area on the screen.
member.param: Pointer to the RECT structure that contains the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the confining rectangle. If this parameter is NULL, the cursor is free to move anywhere on the screen.
member.returns: Returns true if successful, or false if an error occurred.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeMethods.MoveWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The MoveWindow function changes the position and dimensions of the specified window. For a top-level window, the position and dimensions are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child window, they are relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.
member.param: Specifies the new position of the left side of the window.
Specifies the new position of the top of the window.
Specifies the new width of the window.
Specifies the new height of the window.

Specifies whether the window is to be repainted. If this parameter is TRUE, the window receives a message. If the parameter is FALSE, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of moving a child window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError/>.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeMethods.ShowWindow(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified window’s show state.
member.param: The handle of the window to change the show status of.

0 = Hide the window. 1 = Show the window and activate it. 2 = Show the window minimized. 3 = Maximize the window. 4 = Show the window in its most recent size and position but do not activate it. 5 = Show the window. 6 = Minimize the window. 7 = Show the window minimized but do not activate it. 8 = Show the window in its current state but do not activate it 9 = Restore the window (not maximized nor minimized).
member.returns: If the window was previously visible, the return value is true. If the window was previously hidden, the return value is false.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeMethods.SetWindowLong(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SetWindowLong function changes an attribute of the specified window. The function also sets the 32-bit (long) value at the specified offset into the extra window memory.
member.param: Handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
Specifies the zero-based offset to the value to be set. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus the size of an integer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the previous value of the specified 32-bit integer. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.NativeMethods.GetSystemMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function is implemented as a macro to maintain compatibility with existing code. Use the menu handle returned by this macro to disable the Close button. There is no other use for the return value.
member.param: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu.

Boolean value of TRUE if GetSystemMenu is to reset the window menu to the default state and destroy the previous window menu, if any. If this parameter is FALSE, GetSystemMenu returns the handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.DwmIsCompositionEnabled(System.Boolean@)

member.param: The pointer that receives the value indicating whether DWM composition is enabled. TRUE if DWM composition is enabled; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.GetMonitorInfo(System.IntPtr,Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MONITORINFO)
member.summary: The MonitorFromWindow function retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: Handle to the display monitor of interest.

Pointer to a MONITORINFO or MONITORINFOEX structure that receives information about the specified display monitor.
You must set the cbSize member of the structure to sizeof(MONITORINFO) or sizeof(MONITORINFOEX) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.
The MONITORINFOEX structure is a superset of the MONITORINFO structure. It has one additional member\: a string that contains a name for the display monitor. Most applications have no use for a display monitor name, and so can save some bytes by using a MONITORINFO structure.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.GetSystemMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The GetSystemMenu function allows the application to access the window menu (also known as the system menu or the control menu) for copying and modifying.
member.param: Handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu.

Specifies the action to be taken. If this parameter is FALSE, GetSystemMenu returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified. If this parameter is TRUE, GetSystemMenu resets the window menu back to the default state. The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.
member.returns: If the bRevert parameter is FALSE, the return value is a handle to a copy of the window menu. If the bRevert parameter is TRUE, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MonitorFromWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The MonitorFromWindow function retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the bounding rectangle of a specified window.
member.param: Handle to the window of interest.
Determines the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display monitor. This parameter can be one of the following values.
member.returns: If the window intersects one or more display monitor rectangles, the return value is an HMONITOR handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the window. If the window does not intersect a display monitor, the return value depends on the value of dwFlags.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SendMessage function sends the specified message to a window or windows. It calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: Handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST, the message is sent to all top\-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible unowned windows, overlapped windows, and pop\-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.
Specifies the message to be sent.
Specifies additional message\-specific information about window.
member.returns: The return value specifies the result of the message processing; it depends on the message sent.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.TrackPopupMenu(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The TrackPopupMenu function displays a shortcut menu at the specified location and tracks the selection of items on the menu. The shortcut menu can appear anywhere on the screen.
member.param: Handle to the shortcut menu to be displayed. The handle can be obtained by calling CreatePopupMenu to create a new shortcut menu, or by calling GetSubMenu to retrieve a handle to a submenu associated with an existing menu item.
Use zero of more of these flags to specify function options.More information can be found on the following link\: http\://msdn2.microsoft.com/en\-us/library/ms648002.aspx
Specifies the horizontal location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.
Specifies the vertical location of the shortcut menu, in screen coordinates.

Handle to the window that owns the shortcut menu. This window receives all messages from the menu. The window does not receive a WM_COMMAND message from the menu until the function returns. If you specify TPM_NONOTIFY in the uFlags parameter, the function does not send messages to the window identified by hWnd. However, you must still pass a window handle in hWnd. It can be any window handle from your application.
member.returns: If you specify TPM_RETURNCMD in the uFlags parameter, the return value is the menu-item identifier of the item that the user selected. If the user cancels the menu without making a selection, or if an error occurs, then the return value is zero. If you do not specify TPM_RETURNCMD in the uFlags parameter, the return value is nonzero if the function succeeds and zero if it fails. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MONITORINFO
member.summary: The MONITORINFO structure contains information about a display monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MONITORINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes. Set the cbSize member to sizeof(MONITORINFO) before calling the GetMonitorInfo function. Doing so lets the function determine the type of structure you are passing to it.

members.member:
A RECT structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates.
Note If the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

A RECT structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates.
Note If the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MONITORINFO.dwFlags
member.summary: A set of flags that represent attributes of the display monitor.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MINMAXINFO
member.summary: The MINMAXINFO structure contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptReserved
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximized width (POINT.x) and the maximized height (POINT.y) of the window. For top-level windows, this value is based on the width of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position of the left side of the maximized window (POINT.x) and the position of the top of the maximized window (POINT.y). For top-level windows, this value is based on the position of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMinTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum tracking width (POINT.x) and the minimum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMINTRACK and SM_CYMINTRACK.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Shared.WindowInterop.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxTrackSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum tracking width (POINT.x) and the maximum tracking height (POINT.y) of the window. This value is based on the size of the virtual screen and can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMAXTRACK and SM_CYMAXTRACK.
